t: I*pn will praise you, Lord,*s with all my heart; before*ld the “gods” I will sing your praise.
I*ln will bow down toward your holy temple and*ld will praise your name for*ld your unfailing love and your faithfulness, for*ln you have so exalted your solemn decree that*ld it surpasses your fame.
When*ln I called, you answered me; you*ld greatly emboldened me.
May*pn all the kings of the earth praise you, Lord,*s when*ld they hear what you have decreed.
May*ln they sing of the ways of the Lord,*s for*ld the glory of the Lord*s is great.
Though*pn the Lord*s is exalted, he looks kindly on the lowly; though*ld lofty, he sees them from afar.
Though*ln I walk in the midst of trouble, you*ld preserve my life. You*ln stretch out your hand against the anger of my foes; with*ld your right hand you save me.
The*ln Lord*s will vindicate me; your*ld love, Lord,*s endures forever— do*ld not abandon the works of your hands.
